text: we took your people are concerned about
the nuclear crisis up in kashima but
there isn't the kind of panic or an
exodus that you might be led to believe
the city is unusually quiet but that's
more due to the fact that there's been
rolling blackouts which have affected
some parts of Tokyo and today there was
the risk that the whole of Tokyo might
experience a blackout and so there was a
rush for workers to go home the power
outages are because I think a dozen or
so nuclear power plants have been
knocked out of the power grid so
contrary to the calm that we've
generally seen among Japanese residence
we have seen exodus of foreigners from
Tokyo the French Embassy for example has
started to move staff out of Tokyo the
u.s. embassy today said that it would
provide assistance for Americans who
wanted to leave and they have also been
companies moving the staff out of Japan
in Tokyo and so we have seen more of a
panic among the foreign population in
Copiah
